item.title: Reading 05: With great power comes great responsibility
Reading 04: Diversity is an issue, what do we do about it
item.description: I think that this issue is an incredibly complicated one.

item.title: Reading 03: Teeter-Totter
item.description: I am not really sure that men and women can really have it all.

item.title: Project 1: Reflection
item.description: In summary, our code of ethics is broken up into five distinct categories. These categories are: Responsibility, Honesty, Contribution to Community, Respect, and Doing the Right Thing.

item.title: Reading 02: ps -aux | grep interview | xargs kill -9
item.description: My job and internship interview process has been fairly typical, though probably less severe than many of my classmates.

item.title: Reading 01: To be a Hack
item.description: Based on the readings and my experience, a hacker is someone who acts based on certain impulses. The best way to evaluate whether or not someone is a hacker is, in my opinion, to examine what their motivation is. My idea of a hacker in terms of computing is not the more modern definition of someone who cracks systems, but is more in line with someone who modern culture would now call a maker

item.title: Reading 00: Question 2: Not just for Superheroes
item.description: In my opinion, programming is not a super power. In fact, I would say that if it was considered to be one, that would lead to dangerous implications.

item.title: Reading 00: Question 1: About Me
item.description: My name is Ryan Michalec. I am from the city Lake Orion, Michigan, which is in the Metro Detroit area.
